Author: Decker#3767
Content:
Just want to remember what we have:

1. "level1" - something from level1, could be anything, like txid of level1, blockhash of level1, or just "Komodo is ahead of Decred" string.
2. "soul" of komodo ... - can be soul of Komodo ))
3. F - unknown hash function with unknown arguments ... 

So, we can act as:

1. F(level1+soul)
2. F(soul+level1)
3. F(level1)+soul
4. level1+F(soul)
5. soul+F(level1)
6. F(soul)+level1
...
and many different ways )

Author: Decker#3767
Content: And other thing ... if we guess that something from level1 is a txid `befb1a8a5b4582852ab4f044b2c20a47f6aa8d89f46f717d5608dfb4634023c2` don't forget that we can hash it as string itself "befb1a8a5b4582852ab4f044b2c20a47f6aa8d89f46f717d5608dfb4634023c2" (64 symbols) or binary data {0xbe, 0xfb ... } (32 symbols) ...

Author: ca333#0118
Content:
@Gam_B1t : https://github.com/ca333/swingtokenGUI/blob/master/src/java/com/vaklinov/zcashui/SeedImportDialog.java#L211

this is the WIF derivation procedure from a seed/passphrase.

Author: ca333#0118
Content: this java code contains all you need. if you have any issues/question just ping me again. @jl777c explained/teached it to me (on a cryptographic level) back in the day via some good C code. it is a core feature of the iguana protocol (= software layer that all our technologies are based on: komodo, dpow, jumblr, barterDEX, etc.) in https://github.com/jl777/supernet for those who are curious.
